alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Freeborn; Nicollet (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 9:56AM CST until January 13 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW ENDING TODAY, DANGEROUSLY COLD TONIGHT INTO NEXT WEEK... .Light snow will continue through the day today, but any accumulation will be less than an inch. Northwest wind gusts of 30 to 35 mph will lead to areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility, especially across western and southern Minnesota. Meanwhile, confidence remains high that dangerously cold wind chills will follow tonight, with widespread values of 25 to 40 degrees below zero likely through early next week. A Wind Chill Warning is in effect for western and southern Minnesota tonight through Sunday morning. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for eastern Minnesota and western Wisconsin tonight through Sunday morning. Looking ahead, these will likely need to be reissued again for Sunday night into Monday morning. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph are resulting in areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Nicollet, Blue Earth and Freeborn Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Don`t forget to limit the amount of time pets stay outdoors. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
